Q_DESC:
You have a stack with full of integers. Sort it in the ascending order using another temporary array by using all stack functionality. 
INPUT:
first line of the input must contain the number of elements to be pushed into the stack
second line of the input must contain all the elements to be pushed into the stack .
OUTPUT:
The stack would be sorted in ascending order using a temporary array and other stack functionalities.
TESTCASE_1:
5
8 1 9 2 6
###---###SEPERATOR---###---
input: [8, 1, 9, 2, 6]
=============== debug logs ================
Element taken out: 6
input: [8, 1, 9, 2]
tmpStack: [6]
Element taken out: 2
input: [8, 1, 9, 6]
tmpStack: [2]
Element taken out: 6
input: [8, 1, 9]
tmpStack: [2, 6]
Element taken out: 9
input: [8, 1]
tmpStack: [2, 6, 9]
Element taken out: 1
input: [8, 9, 6, 2]
tmpStack: [1]
Element taken out: 2
input: [8, 9, 6]
tmpStack: [1, 2]
Element taken out: 6
input: [8, 9]
tmpStack: [1, 2, 6]
Element taken out: 9
input: [8]
tmpStack: [1, 2, 6, 9]
Element taken out: 8
input: [9]
tmpStack: [1, 2, 6, 8]
Element taken out: 9
input: []
tmpStack: [1, 2, 6, 8, 9]
=============== debug logs ended ================
final sorted list: [1, 2, 6, 8, 9]

Element taken out: 1
input: [8, 5, 3]
tmpStack: [1]
Element taken out: 3
input: [8, 5]
tmpStack: [1, 3]
Element taken out: 5
input: [8]
tmpStack: [1, 3, 5]
